title: Mehbooba Mufti wants Centre's intervention for safe return of students from Iran
content: According to estimates, a little over 10,000 Indians, including students, are currently living in Iran

title: Maharashtra civic polls: Opposition raises concerns over marker pens used instead of indelible ink, BMC to probe complaints
content: The ink on the finger after voting can be removed with a sanitiser. Instead of ink, pens are being used after voting, says Maharashta Navnirman Sena (MNS) Chief Raj Thackeray

title: Two sports trainees found dead in hostel in Kerala
content: The reason for the deaths is yet to be ascertained; police will record statements from other sportspersons in the hostel, their trainers and relatives, an official said

title: Indian Army stands as steadfast shield of nation: Kharge
content: On Indian Army Day, we bow in reverence and gratitude to our brave soldiers, veterans, ex-servicemen and their families, says Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge

title: President Murmu, PM Modi hail Indian armed forces personnel on Army Day
content: PM Modi said the country remembers with deep respect those who have laid down their lives in the line of duty

title: At least five killed, ten injured in van-tractor collision in Bhopal
content: A pickup van headed for Narmadapuram and the tractor trolley collided head-on, Berasia police station inspector in-charge Vijendra Sen said

title: Voting underway for high-stakes civic polls in Maharashtra; all eyes on big battle for Mumbai
content: Except for Mumbai, the other urban bodies have multi-member wards. Vote count will take place on January 16

title: How are cryptocurrency exchanges in India vetting customers? | Explained
content: Cryptocurrency exchanges in India use a range of methods to verify their customers and prevent money-laundering and the financing of terrorism

title: Air India, IndiGo international flights impacted by Iran airspace closure
content: Air India said in a statement that some flights where currently rerouting is not possible are being cancelled

title: Uproar as rats roam near beds, oxygen pipes in Gonda Hospital; Opposition raises concern for patient safety
content: With the video going viral, the Opposition alleged that the health infrastructure in the State is in a shambles

title: City coughs, sputters, as Bhogi fires burn; 4 stations record poor air quality
content: TNPCB data showed that in the 24 hours ending 8 a.m. on Tuesday, four stations out of 15, registered poor air quality

title: Villagers in Odisha seek restoration of land as thermal power plant fails to take off
content: They alleged corporate went into liquidation and right to transfer land parcels was given to another company without taking them into confidence

title: Bihar Chief Secretary makes geo-spatial approval mandatory for DPRs of infra projects above ₹50 crore
content: Departments were instructed to incorporate geo-spatial inputs at the planning stage itself to avoid technical, administrative, and land-related obstacles at later stages.

title: Indore water contamination: Medical panel pegs death toll at 15
content: The panel, consisting of five doctors from the government-run Mahatma Gandhi Medical (MGM) College, has submitted a report to the State authorities confirming 15 deaths even as the official figure remains at six

title: Political parties make pitch for 2027 Punjab election at Maghi Mela
content: AAP govt. will make provision in budget to give ₹1,000 per month to every woman, says Mann; Akali Dal chief lists poll promises; BJP holds first independent political rally at annual gathering

title: Suvendu warns West Bengal CM of legal action over coal scam remarks
content: In a post on X, the Leader of the Opposition claimed that the deadline given to Mamata Banerjee to respond to a defamation notice served by him had expired

title: Tej Pratap urges younger brother Tejashwi Yadav to merge RJD into his party
content: He said this on the occasions of Dahi-Chura feast which he has organised at his residence in Patna. Even his father and RJD Chief Lalu Prasad also attended the feast who had once expelled him from the party and snapped even family ties with him.

title: Kerala Kalolsavam 2026 | From melody to motion, students dazzle on festival stage
content: The 64th State School Arts Festival opens in Thrissur with dazzling performances by high school girls in the light music contest, alongside Mohiniyattam, group dance, and myriad art forms. Thousands of participants and spectators celebrate the talent, culture, and rich artistic heritage.

title: Union Minister welcomes INSV Kaundinya crew at Muscat port
content: Azzan Al Busaidi, under secretary, Tourism, Ministry of Heritage and Tourism of Oman, along with senior dignitaries from the Indian Navy, Royal Navy of Oman, Royal Oman Police Coast Guard, and other ministries were present.

title: Lokayukta registers case over large-scale government land scam in Nagamangala taluk
content: The accused include serving and former government officials and private individuals. A  criminal case has been registered against 11 persons in connection with the scam, and five government officials have been arrested.

title: Conditions favourable for cessation of NE monsoon; fog to continue in A.P.
content: Except for two, districts in Andhra Pradesh have either recorded excess or normal rainfall during south-west and north-east monsoon seasons

title: Centre asks A.P. to expand PPP model to ensure better healthcare services
content: State Health Secretary receives a letter containing suggestions in key areas of nuclear medicine, radiology, cancer daycare centres, dental clinics and mobile medical units

title:
Mumbai model to help build 
self-financing cities in Andhra Pradesh
content: A delegation from the State, during a recent two-day tour, studied advanced practices in regional governance, land-based financing, transit-oriented development and slum redevelopment in Mumbai Metropolitan Region

title: BSF, ITBP and NIA get new chiefs
content: Shatrujeet Singh Kapoor for ITBP, Praveen Kumar for BSF and Rakesh Aggarwal for NIA were proposed by the Home Ministry

title: TET results sparks concern among in-service teachers, unions seek exemption
content: Test outcome triggers a debate, with teacher unions arguing that when more than half of the teachers fail to qualify, it clearly indicates that the examination does not reflect classroom teaching competencies

title: Australia classifies Indian students ‘high-risk’, tightens visa scrutiny
content: It improves quality over quantity, say experts; this means requiring detailed financial proof, full traceability of source of funds, a strict ‘Genuine Student’ assessment, which may include interviews, and slower and manual checks of documentation

title: 29 Maharashtra civic bodies go to polls on January 15; Mumbai is big prize
content: More than 3.48 crore voters will cast their votes to choose 2,869 corporators from among 15,908 candidates; Votes will be counted on January 16

title: Uncontested victories in Mumbai local polls valid under the law: Bombay High Court
content: The opposition claimed that mass withdrawals were not ‘voluntary’ and Mahayuti allies used coercion, forcing candidates to withdraw

title: Cong leader booked for threatening and abusing Municipal Commissioner
content: The Congress leader threatened the Municipal Commissioner over a flex and banner to promote Kannada film Cult that was removed for violating norms

title: Nipah-hit Bengal nurses critical; two contacts hospitalised
content: One nurse is in coma and the other is on ventilator support; 120 people who came into contact with them have been directed to isolate themselves; State govt. launches helpline to guide public

title: Meitei, Kuki-Zo insurgent groups warned against violating ground rules, continuing extortion
content: MHA, State officials conduct joint review of insurgent groups; UNLF-P, a Meitei group, asked to return looted weapons to police armouries; Kuki-Zo groups asked to relocate seven camps, enforce ground rules

title: KIIFB model should be modernised to turbocharge State’s infrastructure development, says Thomas Isaac
content: Kerala’s new developmental phase can be meaningfully realised by preparing and implementing an action plan focused on a knowledge economy that builds upon the advances made in education, says former Finance Minister

title: UGC brings out new rules against caste discrimination
content: Higher education institutions may lose recognition if they violate the regulations; UGC brings OBCs under the ambit of new rules after their exclusion in the draft version evoked criticism; commission drops proposal to impose penalty for false complaint

title: Marriage halls seek reduction in GST rates, power charges
content: The Tamil Nadu Marriage Hall Owners Association, South India Marriage Hall Owners Federation, and All Kalyana Mandapam Owners Association have jointly written to the respective State governments and the Centre seeking a significant reduction in GST rates

title: Why Gen Z could influence outcome of next civic elections?
content: Parties are scouting candidates and coming up with strategies to strike a chord with a new generation of voters.

title: Mumbai civic elections: Confusing coalitions, absent accountability concern voters as BMC goes to polls
content: Experts are split over voter turnout and air quality remains forgotten as city votes after nine years

title: Quick commerce players’ pledge to drop 10-minute delivery comes as a thumbs up for Kerala
content: In a notice issued on December 23, Kerala Motor Vehicles department had directed the online delivery app companies in Kerala to follow road safety rules and make it part of their corporate policy

title: Jana Nayagan row: Supreme Court to hear producer’s appeal on January 15
content: The Bench would hear KVN Productions’ challenge against the decision of a two-judge Bench of the High Court to stay a single judge’s order to issue U/A 16+ certificate to the film, hours after it was passed.

title: Police profiling of mosques as crime sites is an attempt to strip Muslims of faith: Mehbooba Mufti
content: Imams, caretakers summoned to police stations, asked to submit extensive personal data, creating fear amomng worshippers, says PDP chief; order for police verification of mosques issued by L-G’s office, says NC

title: Farmers raise concerns over paddy procurement through coop. societies
content: They argue that cooperative societies lack both the expertise to manage large-scale procurement efficiently and the ability to pay farmers within two days of collection

title: Actor rape case survivor’s counsel complains to Kerala HC Chief Justice against judge
content: In the complaint, T.B. Mini says Ernakulam District and Principal Sessions Judge Honey M. Varghese, who pronounced the verdict in the case, made derogatory remarks against her

title: Karnataka Information Commission wants 17 of its newly supplied computers to be replaced
content: One of the important specifications for the computers was to have cameras, which, however, are not in the 17 computers supplied

title: Kerala School Kalolsavam 2026 / Celebrating silent spaces of creativity
content: For many gathered at the venue, participating in competitions such as short story writing, cartooning, or essay writing, moments of effort and emotion often pass unnoticed, far removed from the glitz and applause of on-stage performances. Yet students prepare for these events with equal diligence, even when their achievements rarely draw public acclaim

title: Sources: Harbaugh, Giants working to finalize deal
content: While contract numbers are still being finalized, John Harbaugh is ready to accept the Giants' head coaching job and the team is expected to hire him as soon as possible, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Mavs' Flagg exits loss to Nuggets with ankle sprain
content: Cooper Flagg twisted his left ankle for the second consecutive game Wednesday night and was ruled out.

title: Texas knocks off No. 10 Vanderbilt in latest upset
content: Texas handed No. 10 Vanderbilt its first loss the season 80-64 on Wednesday night, giving the Longhorns consecutive victories over AP Top 25 teams.

title: Knicks' Brunson ruled out after spraining ankle
content: Knicks star Jalen Brunson played just five minutes Wednesday against the Kings before an ankle injury in the first quarter ended his night early.

title: Young (MCL, quad) still out through All-Star break
content: New Washington Wizards star Trae Young is still recovering from MCL and quad injuries on his right leg and will be reevaluated after the mid-February All-Star break, coach Brian Keefe said Wednesday.

title: Coco, Venus could meet early at Australian Open
content: Coco Gauff and Venus Williams could meet in the second round of the Australian Open, more than six years after they first played each other in a major. Jannik Sinner and Novak Djokovic landed in the same half of the draw, setting up a potential semifinal.

title: Source: Commanders to hire son of Doug Williams
content: The Commanders are hiring D.J. Williams, the son of franchise great Doug Williams, to be their quarterbacks coach, the latest addition to a new-look staff under Dan Quinn.

title: NCAA asks CFTC to suspend prediction markets
content: The NCAA asked a federal regulatory body to stop prediction markets from offering trades on college sports until more safeguards are in place.

title: LB Styles joins Buckeyes stars declaring for draft
content: Linebacker Sonny Styles, who is ESPN insider Mel Kiper's No. 7 overall prospect, became the fifth Ohio State star to declare for the 2026 NFL draft.

title: Who deserves to make the NBA All-Star team: We made 25 picks
content: Locks? Bubble watch? A bonus 25th player?! We're unveiling our 2026 rosters full of legends, first-timers and a few difficult cuts.

title: Ranking all 32 rookie classes in the NFL: There's the top four ... then everybody else
content: How does every NFL team's rookie group stack up? Aaron Schatz ranked all 32 based on first-year production, starting with surprises up top.

title: Barnwell: How did the Steelers end up here, and should they lean into a rebuild under a new coach?
content: Mike Tomlin and the Steelers have parted ways. But will Pittsburgh now change its roster-building approach under the next coach? And who should replace Tomlin?

title: Nine teams that need to turn around their seasons -- now
content: From expected Final Four contenders like Kentucky and beyond, these teams have work to do in the final stretch.

title: Updated NBA mock draft: Projecting who lands at Nos. 1 through 30
content: Which new names enter Jeremy Woo's updated 2026 NBA mock draft and who slid into the top 30 picks or out of the first round?

title: How Seahawks started over at QB with Sam Darnold and got back to the playoffs
content: It's been 10 months since the Seahawks traded Geno Smith and signed Darnold. Now they're back in the playoffs.

title: Rival leagues, charter flights and T-shirts: 11 moments that led to WNBA labor strife
content: CBA negotiations intensified in recent months, but previous events helped spark the stalemate between the WNBA and WNBPA.

title: A slam for Scheffler? What's next for Rory? Storylines to watch heading into 2026 PGA Tour season
content: What will the biggest names on tour do in 2026? What will Brooks Koepka's return look like? We dive into some of the biggest stories to watch as the season gets started

title: Premier League's top 50 transfers of all time: Who is No. 1?
content: What makes a great signing? Is it trophies won, goals scored, a long run of dominance ... or all of the above? Bill Connelly breaks down the best 50 Premier League moves since it began in 1992-93.

title: Arsenal take first step to end long-standing semifinal curse
content: In a thriller at Stamford Bridge, Mikel Arteta's Arsenal took a major step toward ending a major trophy drought.

title: Why did Man United, Chelsea, Real Madrid all sack their managers? It's about culture
content: Why have three of the biggest soccer teams in the world fired their managers in the span of just 12 days? To clubs like Man United or Real Madrid, it's not about results, but how they fit.

title: Cancelo isn't the center back Flick wanted, but might be the fullback Barça need
content: João Cancelo's return to Barcelona began in confusion, but his loan move could give the team a boost.

title: How Miami offensive coordinator Shannon Dawson emerged from nowhere
content: The architect of the Hurricanes' offense began his career grinding for a job at Southeastern Louisiana.

title: What would a Russian Olympic hockey team look like in 2026?
content: The Games will be missing one of the sport's top countries. Here's what the group could have looked like had it been competing.

title: Boxing fights we want to see in 2026: Haney-Garcia 2, Canelo-Benavidez, more
content: A lot of major fights took place in 2025 -- but which megafights do we want to see in the year ahead?

title: Supreme Court takes up transgender athlete cases
content: The Supreme Court got complex arguments and passionate demonstrations as it considered two cases related to transgender athletes.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Kanté to return to Europe?
content: French midfielder N'Golo Kanté could make his return to Europe playing in Turkey. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Opinion: Opinion | All Talk, No Take-Off: The Reality Of Pakistan's JF-17 Hype
content: The spotlight Pakistan presently finds itself under, particularly in the aftermath of the May 2025 conflict with India, is less about a single jet and more about a broader rebranding effort.

title: "Ink Mark Can Be Wiped Off With Sanitiser": Raj Thackeray After Voting In Mumbai
content: Raj Thackeray was speaking to reporters after voting for elections to the 227-ward Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC).

title: Why Regime Change In Iran Could Hurt India, But Benefit Pakistan, China
content: As Iran's clerical leadership struggles to contain protests fuelled by economic hardship and political fatigue, India is watching events unfold with quiet unease.

title: "Can Men Get Pregnant?" Indian-American Doctor Asked During Abortion Hearing
content: The tense discussion came during the HELP Committee hearing titled "Protecting Women: Exposing the Dangers of Chemical Abortion Drugs," at the Dirksen Senate Office Building.

title: As Tensions With Iran Escalate, How US Bases In Middle East Are Positioned
content: US President Donald Trump has warned of potential military action against Iran, which is witnessing nationwide protests over soaring inflation and a never-ending economic crisis.

title: Captain's Relative Summoned In AI-171 Probe, Pilots' Body Alleges "Narrative"
content: The Federation of Indian Pilots has sent a legal notice to the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau after the latter summoned a pilot related to Captain Sumeet Sabharwal, who was flying Air India 171 when it crashed

title: How India's "Robin Hood" Tantya Bhil Became A Political Scam In Madhya Pradesh
content: Tribals are once again at the centre of Madhya Pradesh politics. Speeches are being made, statues are being unveiled, leaders are paying tributes, and social media is full of references to tribal icons.

title: Tension In Hyderabad Over Temple Vandalism; Asaduddin Owaisi Visits Spot
content: Tension prevailed at the Puranapul Darwaza in Hyderabad last night after unidentified persons vandalised a temple, leading to concern among the locals and a gathering near the site.

title: Indian-Origin New Jersey Woman Arrested, Charged With Murder Of 2 Sons
content: US authorities have arrested and charged a 35-year old Indian-origin woman in New Jersey with murdering her two young children.

title: Vijay Emerges Key Pivot In Anti-DMK Strategy As NDA Plans Mega Chennai Show
content: Actor-turned-politician Vijay has emerged as a central figure in the opposition's evolving calculations in Tamil Nadu.

title: Opinion: Opinion | 26 Reasons Gen Z Will Back Mamata In 2026
content: The number of universities in Bengal has increased from 12 in 2011 to 47 now. Fourteen new medical colleges, 51 new government colleges, and 500 new ITIs have been established.

title: Magh Mela: Over 21 Lakh Take Dip At Sangam On Makar Sankranti
content: More than 21 lakh devotees took dip in the Ganga and the Sangam at the ongoing Magh Mela here on Thursday on the occasion of Makar Sankranti, officials said.

title: Assam Student Alleges Assault In Madhya Pradesh Over Northeast Identity
content: A first-year MA Economics student from Assam was allegedly brutally assaulted inside the Indira Gandhi National Tribal University (IGNTU) hostel in Madhya Pradesh after his attackers questioned him about his name and home state.

title: Man Shot In Leg During Federal Immigration Operation In US: Report
content: A man was shot in the leg on Wednesday night during a federal immigration enforcement operation in north Minneapolis, the Minnesota Star Tribune reported, citing multiple sources with knowledge of the situation.

title: Police Arrest 2 Shooters Linked To Lawrence Bishnoi Gang In Delhi
content: Police have arrested two persons allegedly linked to the Lawrence Bishnoi gang after a shootout in north Delhi, sources said on Thursday.

title: 2 Girls Found Hanging At Sports Authority Of India Hostel In Kerala's Kollam
content: Two sports trainees were found hanging in a room at a Sports Authority of India (SAI) hostel in Kerala's Kollam on Thursday, police said.

title: Popular Avaniyapuram Jallikattu Kicks Off, Over 1,000 Bulls Taking Part
content: January in Tamil Nadu is not only about the Thai Pongal harvest festival but also about Jallikattu, the ancient and traditional sport that showcases the bravery of the state's youth.

title: US Could Hit Tehran In 24 Hours, Warn European Officials Amid Iran Protests
content: The United States is withdrawing some personnel from bases in the Middle East, a US official said on Wednesday, after a senior Iranian official said Tehran had warned neighbours it would hit American bases if Washington strikes.

title: UP Cop Attacks Wife, 3-Year-Old Daughter During Domestic Dispute, Child Dies
content: A police constable in Uttar Pradesh's Banda district allegedly attacked his wife and three-year-old daughter with a sharp-edged weapon during a domestic dispute, leaving the child dead and the woman seriously injured, officials said on Thursday.

title: Watch: British Sikhs rescue schoolgirl from flat, say she was groomed by Afghan man
content: Around 200 Sikhs surrounded a Hounslow council flat Sunday night, alleging an Afghan man was grooming a 16-year-old Sikh girl. Protesters confronted the man, accusing him of manipulation, while a neighbor reported seeing underage girls at the flat over years. Police intervened, taking the man away and reuniting the girl with her family.

title: 'Don't repeat the same mistake': Iran warns Trump amid deadly protests; flags 'Israeli plot'
content: Iran closed its airspace amid US threats over protests, with the foreign minister denying mass casualties and blaming external "terrorists." President Trump warned of action, while Iran extended airspace closure, causing flight disruptions. US personnel were advised to evacuate a base in Qatar as tensions rise.

title: Kerala: 2 girl trainee athletes found hanging at Sports Authority of India hostel
content: Two teenage sports trainees, aged 17 and 15, were discovered hanging in their room at a Sports Authority of India hostel in Kerala. The incident was reported by fellow inmates who noticed their absence from morning training. Police are investigating the deaths, with no immediate cause or suicide note found.

title: IND vs NZ: More than a finisher - KL Rahul makes case for bigger middle-overs role
content: KL Rahul's composed century against New Zealand showcased a newfound clarity and control, a stark contrast to his career's past uncertainties. Batting at number five, he displayed classic ODI prowess, proving old-school techniques still hold value. This assured knock, his first ODI ton since the World Cup, highlights his dedication to establishing a stable role in the team.

title: Gates Foundation shut down begins: $9bn outlay, 500 jobs to go; closure set for 2045
content: Bill Gates is initiating the phased closure of his influential foundation by 2045, with a record $9 billion budget planned for 2026. The organization will cut up to 500 staff positions over five years to manage operating costs.

title: Gold, silver prediction: Will gold hit Rs 1.5 lakh and silver Rs 3.2 lakh?
content: Gold and silver price prediction today: Abhilash Koikkara, Head of Nuvama Professional Clients Group sees gold and silver prices hitting new lifetime highs in the coming days.

title: ‘Jana Nayagan’: Why SC sent Thalapathy's starrer film back to high court
content: The Supreme Court has directed the makers of Thalapathy Vijay's 'Jana Nayagan' to return to the Madras High Court regarding CBFC clearance. The apex court refused to intervene, emphasizing the High Court's division bench should hear the matter. This follows the High Court's stay on a single judge's order for film certification, leaving the movie's release pending.

title: Google adds Personal Intelligence to Gemini: AI mines app data; offers tailored answers
content: Google's new Personal Intelligence feature for Gemini AI is now in beta for paid US subscribers. It allows the assistant to access your Gmail, Photos, YouTube, and Search history for highly personalized recommendations.  This upgrade aims to provide tailored advice, from car maintenance to travel planning, by understanding your digital life. Users control data access, with privacy safeguards in place.

title: 'Poor planning': Nithin Kamath questions stock market closure during BMC polls
content: Zerodha founder Nithin Kamath criticized the closure of Indian stock exchanges on January 15 for Mumbai's municipal elections, citing poor planning and a lack of appreciation for second-order effects. He argued that such a holiday, driven by local civic polls, undermines global investor confidence. Trading is set to resume on January 16 after the election-related holiday.

title: Exclusive | ‘Tell Vinesh, I want to wrestle her again’: Yui Susaki reflects on Paris defeat
content: Japanese wrestling champion Yui Susaki, a four-time world champion and Olympic gold medalist, expressed her desire to face Indian wrestler Vinesh Phogat again after a surprising defeat. Susaki views the loss as a crucial learning experience, fueling her ambition for future Olympic gold medals and inspiring others with her resilience.

title: Zuckerberg hired Wang for $14B, now they're clashing: AI team in chaos; new boss moves in
content: Meta's new structure reveals tension between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, the $14 billion AI recruit. Wang finds Zuckerberg's micromanagement stifling, while staff question his leadership for Meta's AI ambitions. A recent strategy clash highlighted differing priorities, with Wang pushing for cutting-edge AI over immediate product integration.

title: Stock market holiday today: Are NSE, BSE closed for trading on Jan 15? Check details
content: The stock market will be closed on January 15th due to Maharashtra municipal corporation elections, with trading suspended across various segments. Equity derivatives contracts originally set to expire on this date will now mature on January 14th.

title: Zero cut-off in NEET PG: Is India lowering the bar to keep hospitals running?
content: The National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS) has lowered NEET PG 2025 cut-offs, allowing candidates with negative marks to enter counselling for over 9,000 vacant PG seats. While officials cite seat utilisation, medical bodies warn this undermines merit, risks patient safety, and threatens the quality of India’s postgraduate medical education, raising urgent questions about training standards and healthcare outcomes.

title: 'Her family warned her': Gisele Bündchen’s family favored Tom Brady over Valente
content: Gisele Bündchen’s family is reportedly uneasy about her marriage to Joaquim Valente, with Tom Brady still serving as a point of comparison. Sources claim relatives worry about financial imbalance and potential prenup loopholes, despite the couple’s happiness and growing family. While Bündchen appears confident in her choice, those closest to her remain cautious about long term security.

title: Knicks vs Kings injury report: Injured players, TV info & team stats
content: The New York Knicks, a healthy Eastern Conference contender, face a depleted Sacramento Kings squad on January 14, 2026.  Injuries sideline key Kings players like Sabonis and Murray, forcing reliance on DeRozan and Westbrook.  New York, bolstered by Josh Hart's return, aims to leverage their defensive strength against a struggling Sacramento team.

title: NHL trade rumors: Senators eye blockbuster trade for Flames star Rasmus Andersson
content: Ottawa's season has faltered, prompting general manager Steve Staios to explore trade options, with defenseman Rasmus Andersson of the Calgary Flames reportedly on their radar. A potential move for Andersson hinges on his willingness to sign an extension with the Senators, as other teams also express interest.

title: Not your ordinary 'Mallika': Inside the mind of India’s first female serial killer
content: Bengaluru's chilling serial murderer, Cyanide Mallika, preyed on vulnerable women by posing as a devout devotee. She gained their trust, lured them to isolated locations for rituals, and poisoned them with cyanide, stealing their valuables. Her calculated crimes, often dismissed as mysterious deaths, were uncovered after her arrest in 2007.

title: 'Unwanted person gets promoted': RSS chief says Nota not best option
content: Mohan Bhagwat said elections are a mandatory part of democracy and hence, voting is the responsibility of all citizens.He appealed to electors that keeping the public interest in mind, everyone should vote for a suitable candidate during the elections.

title: 'Skipped tournament due to extreme Delhi air': Danish shuttler shares AQI screenshot
content: Danish badminton player Anders Antonsen withdrew from the India Open for the third consecutive year, citing "extreme" air pollution in Delhi. He believes the current pollution levels make the city unsuitable for hosting a badminton tournament, following similar concerns raised by his compatriot Mia Blichfeldt.

title: Nasa sends 4 astronauts back to Earth in first medical evacuation - watch
content: In a historic event for NASA, four astronauts — two Americans, a Russian, and a Japanese — have returned to Earth early from the International Space Station due to a medical concern. This pioneering orbital medical evacuation cuts their mission short by more than a month, culminating in a safe splashdown in the Pacific.

title: Teen prodigy on Kohli's heels: Sooryavanshi eyes big milestone; India begin U19 WC quest
content: India's U-19 World Cup campaign kicks off with 14-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi poised to break Virat Kohli's Youth ODI run record.  Sooryavanshi, already with 973 runs in 18 innings, needs just six more to surpass Kohli's mark. This prodigious talent is a key player for the favoured Indian squad, aiming for a record sixth title.

title: ‘Jesus Christ of Los Angeles’: Why a Bihari man selling Rs 780 tea and Rs 1,512 poha is trending
content: A Bihar-born vendor in Los Angeles, Prabhakar Prasad, has gone viral for selling Indian tea at Rs 782 and poha at Rs 1,512. His simple food stall and relatable demeanor, even earning him the nickname 'Jesus Christ of Los Angeles,' have captivated social media users globally, sparking conversations about Indian cuisine abroad.

title: PM Modi's moment from Makar Sankranti; feeds cows at his residence — watch
content: In the 39-second clip, PM Modi was seen standing outdoors on a lawn in Lok Kalyan Marg, offering feed to the cows, which were adorned with decorative cloths, keeping with traditional festival practices. The festival marks the Sun’s transition into the zodiac sign of Capricorn (Makar) and is celebrated as a mid-winter harvest festival.

title: Woman gang-raped by 5 at Bahadurgarh dhaba; how UPI liquor payment led to 4 arrests
content: A 42-year-old woman was allegedly gangraped at a deserted dhaba in Bahadurgarh after being followed from a bus. Police arrested four of the five accused, with a digital payment transaction proving a critical lead in identifying the suspects. Efforts are ongoing to apprehend the remaining perpetrator.

title: Grok image generation ban: xAI blocks sexualised deepfakes; paid users face new limits
content: In response to mounting backlash and regulatory scrutiny, Grok AI has ceased the creation of explicit images of real individuals. xAI has introduced stringent technical measures to curb misuse, particularly addressing concerns around deepfake content involving women and minors. Furthermore, image generation and editing services are now reserved for paid X subscribers, with geoblocking mechanisms implemented to filter illegal material.

title: Abandoned 41 years ago as 3-day-old in Nagpur, Dutch mayor back to find mom
content: In 1985, a baby left behind in Nagpur found his way into a warm and welcoming family in the Netherlands, eventually rising to the position of Mayor of Heemstede. Now, with a strong yearning to reconnect with his origins, he has embarked on a quest to find his birth mother.

title: Bangladesh cricket in turmoil: Players threaten boycott; BCB disowns director's remarks
content: Bangladesh cricket faces turmoil as a BCB director's remarks spark player boycott threats and jeopardize World Cup participation. The board distanced itself from the comments, emphasizing player welfare, while security concerns over playing in India persist. Former players and associations condemned the public criticism, highlighting damage to the sport's image.

title: Punjabi businessman shot dead in Canada: 3rd incident in 8 months
content: A Punjabi businessman, Binder Garcha, was shot dead in Surrey, Canada. This incident follows similar killings of prominent Punjabi businessmen in the region. Garcha owned a wedding photography and videography business. Authorities are investigating the crime, with a burnt vehicle found. The community is alarmed by these targeted attacks.

title: Cold wave freezes Delhi-NCR: IMD issues 'yellow' alert; flight ops impacted
content: Delhi woke up to dense fog and cold wave conditions on Thursday. The India Meteorological Department issued a yellow alert. Some relief is expected from Friday as temperatures are set to rise. A feeble western disturbance will approach, pushing up night temperatures. Fresh snowfall is likely in the Himalayan region around January 16. Delhi's air quality remains very poor.

title: IND vs NZ: ‘The team is suffering’ - Ex-India batter highlights lack of sixth bowler
content: Former India batter Kris Srikkanth has voiced concerns over India's ODI team balance, questioning Axar Patel's continued exclusion. He highlighted Ravindra Jadeja's inconsistent form and the team's need for a reliable sixth bowling option, especially after their recent loss to New Zealand. Srikkanth believes Axar's inclusion would strengthen the bowling attack.

title: Bank holiday today: Are banks closed on January 15 for Sankranti & BMC elections?
content: Banks across several Indian states are closed today, January 15, 2026, for various regional festivals and local elections.  Residents in Maharashtra, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Sikkim, Telangana, Uttar Pradesh, and Andhra Pradesh should note these closures.  Plan your banking needs accordingly, as many branches will remain shut for upcoming holidays throughout January.

title: Budget 2026: Industry flags customs litigation, compliance bottlenecks as key pain points
content: Despite broader government pushes under the Digital India programme, customs adjudication and litigation remain heavily paper-driven. Businesses are still required to file physical replies to show cause notices.

title: CBSE invites schools to join UPU 2026 letter writing competition - check details
content: CBSE has invited its affiliated schools to participate in the 55th UPU International Letter Writing Competition 2026, organised by the Department of Posts. Students are asked to write letters on the theme of why human connection matters in a digital world. The competition aims to foster creativity, writing skills, and global friendship, with top entries advancing to the international stage.

title: BMC elections: Akshay Kumar and Twinkle Khanna cast their vote
content: Bollywood stars Akshay Kumar and Twinkle Khanna were among the early voters in the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation elections. Akshay urged citizens to vote for the right leaders, calling it their "remote control" day. Twinkle expressed that voting provides a sense of control and power. The elections are crucial for local governance across Maharashtra's urban centers.

title: Manisha Sharma’s inspiring MasterChef run: Udaipur girl's fight against Parkinson’s
content: Manisha Sharma, a MasterChef India contestant, is captivating audiences with her inspiring journey. Diagnosed with secondary Parkinson's at 14, she found solace and purpose in cooking, transforming it into her therapy and passion. Her calm, confident presence and heartfelt story have resonated deeply, making her a symbol of strength and resilience.

title: Akshay Khanna's character to return in 'Dhurandhar 2' on popular demand - Report
content: Akshaye Khanna's unforgettable portrayal of Rehman Dakait is reportedly making waves again in 'Dhurandhar 2', the sequel to Aditya Dhar's box-office sensation. Although his character seemed to meet a tragic end in the first installment, the filmmakers are devising innovative flashbacks and reshoots to revisit him. Read on to know more.

title: BCB says players, not board, will lose money if it pulls out from T20 WC
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board's finance chief stated the board won't face financial loss if the team withdraws from the T20 World Cup, attributing potential losses to players' match fees and bonuses. He emphasized that the board's revenue is secured until 2027, dismissing compensation for players.

title: 'Dhurandhar' day 41: Film gives tough competition to 'The Raja Saab'
content: 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, continues its phenomenal box office run, nearing its sixth week. The film has shattered records since its December 5 release, now challenging 'The Raja Saab'. After a slight dip, it rebounded strongly, with its total collection estimated at a staggering Rs 813 crore nett, Rs 976.1 crore gross, and Rs 1269.1 crore worldwide.

title: ‘Stranger Things’ documentary director addresses ChatGPT rumors
content: In a fascinating twist, whispers circulated that the finale of 'Stranger Things' might have had AI's fingerprints on it after a ChatGPT tab was spotted during a recent documentary. However, Director Martina Radwan swiftly dismissed these theories, asserting there's no proof of artificial intelligence being involved, and praised the episode as a culmination of heartfelt human collaboration and creativity.

title: Wayne Gretzky net worth timeline 2016–2026: earnings, investments and endorsements
content: Wayne Gretzky's net worth has grown to $250 million by 2026, a significant increase from his $200 million in 2016. This financial success, nearly quadrupling his career earnings, highlights his savvy business acumen through endorsements, strategic investments in real estate, and ownership stakes, proving his enduring brand power beyond hockey.

title: NL Central urgency ratings: How much work each team still needs to do
content: the difference in offseason activity level in the national league central has been stark . on the other side of the division, the Chicago Cubs and Pittsburgh Pirates have been active in attempting to improve for the 2026 season . we've assigned each team an urgency rating -- from 1 to 5 .

title: Teams winning the MLB offseason so far -- and those that need to make a big move soon
content: major league baseball's free agent pool remains flush with talent this winter . there are big bats, a front-of-the-rotation arm, power, veteran pitchers and even an every-day catcher . the reality, particularly for teams playing at the top of the market, is that this might be their last opportunity to land a bat in free agency for years .
